location.reputation: Known as the 'Number One Wondrous Mountain under Heaven' (중국제일기산). A holy site for Taoism and Art.

heritage.mythology: Associated with the Yellow Emperor (Gongsun Xuanyuan / 공손헌원).
heritage.culture: A gathering place for artists (painters, calligraphers) due to the scenery.

status.tier: Tier 2 or Hidden Tier (Often excluded from the 'Nine Great Sects' in Korean Wuxia despite the mountain's fame).
status.reasoning: Overshadowed by the standardized '9 Sects 1 Gang' trope, but holds immense potential due to the Xuanyuan legend.

combat_style.visuals: Movements resemble calligraphy strokes or painting techniques.
combat_style.duality: Contains both righteous Taoist arts and surprisingly vicious/aggressive techniques (Poison, Demon Claws).

list.name: 무영검 (Shadowless Sword)
list.description: Signature Art. So fast and stealthy it leaves no shadow. Contains hidden beauty visible only to masters.

list: 금마신공 (Gold Demon Divine Art) - Suggests a darker or more aggressive side.
백독비무공 (Hundred Poison Flying Mist Art) - Atypical for a righteous sect; implies poison usage.
운해환종보 (Cloud Sea Illusion Track Step) - Inspired by the famous Sea of Clouds of Mt. Huang.

axe: 패왕부 (Tyrant Axe) - Domineering style contrasting with the sect's elegance.

list: 쇄심마조 (Heart Crushing Demon Claw) - Vicious technique.

narrative_role: A sect of 'Warrior-Artists' who judge the protagonist by their taste in art as well as martial skill.
Keeper of the Yellow Emperor's ancient legacy (Hidden Dungeon/Treasure).
A faction with a duality: Beautiful scenery on the outside, but hiding 'Demon' and 'Poison' arts within.
